intro: Wahlenbergia albomarginata, commonly known as the white-margin bellflower, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, white flowers with a distinctive yellow margin. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. It produces small, blue-green leaves that are often hairy, and it is known for its compact, low-growing habit. Wahlenbergia albomarginata is prized in horticulture for its ornamental value and ability to bloom throughout the growing season.
